Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 02:34PM brady0819 wrote: Thank you so much, ladies. You are all such a wonder of support. I am grateful for you ALL. I think I am starting to go crazy over this BC scare. I know that I should be happy that I got benign results from both my core needle and stereotactic biopsies, but now am questioning whether I should have just done the excisional biopsy as well.  I keep wondering if there is possibility of getting 2 false negative results. Crazy, huh???? Just tell me that those odds are very low. I have pushed my 6 month follow up to Feb 1st (making it now a 5 month follow-up) just so I can get it over with and move on...whether good or bad.  I tired of constantly feeling around my breasts for possible lumps.  i just don't want to be scared anymore.  I feel that this is consuming me. And then I feel terrible because so many wonderful, beautiful, courageous women received unexptected, not-so-good results and are being so much stronger than I am. Thank you all for your support

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2010 11:24AM brady0819 wrote: Hi Jen: Sorry you are going through this, but I am sending good vibes your way.  Last year (Sept 14 to be exact) I went for my first mammo due to a painful lump on my left breast.  Turns out that was nothing to worry about. But they found a lump on my right breast. Had mammo and ultrasound. Birad 4.  1.6cm  somewhat ill defined.  posterior shadowing.  Everything I read led me to believe I had BC.  I had 2 biopsies (ultrasound core needle and mammatome). Both came back benign.  I worried myself sick over it.  I had a 6 month mammo follow up and all is fine. Now I am due for another mammo.  Still scared to death to get it done.  You are not alone.  We are all here for you.  Have a relaxing weekend and drink a glass (or five or six) of wine and try not to think of the bad.

Posts.Title: Anyone with dense breasts - lump on upper outer quadrant brady0819 ddbaker

Posts.Content: brady0819 wrote: Hi Girls: In September I went for my initial mammo (age 37) because of a painful lump that I felt on my left breast. It is on the upper outer quadrant.  It really only hurts when I touch it.  It almost feels like a bruise...more tender than painful. I had a mammo and ultrasound and they saw nothing concerning on that left breast (however, I had to have 2 biopsies for an unpalpable lump on my right breast...total shock.  Luckily both biopsies showed normal breast tissue...I am having a follow up mammo in Feb...scared out of my mind). I saw my OBG about this lump on my left breast and he seems to think it is purely hormonal as it pops up 2 weeks before my period (right around ovulation time).  He did state that I have very very dense fibrocystic breasts.  There is the same lump on my right breast in the same general area (not as big though) and this one does not cause me pain.  The pain does seem to go away during my period, but then pops up about 10 days later. Of course I keep touching this area constantly (which my doc told me not to do as I exacerbate the problem).  Just wondering if anyone else experiences this and if in fact, it is just fibrocystic disease. I am not too concerned about this as my mammo and ultrasound showed nothing, but it is rather annoying.  I am very worried about my follow up mammo though.  Even after having an ultrasound core needle and stereotactic biopsies on the unpalpable area that showed nothing I feel like I am obsessing over touching my breasts and trying to feel for lumps. It is very hard to detect lumps wtih such dense breasts.  Any advice???? Thanks  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: brady0819 wrote: I got back from my stereotactic biopsy this morning.  I had a core needle biopsy last week which yeilded benign breast tissue results. I am 37 years old with no hx of bc.  I have a 1.6cm mass, oval, smooth edges, no calcifications, but with shadowing.  Anyone get benign results with shadowing appear on ultrasound? This fiasco has been going on now for 10 days since my screening mammogram last Monday.  I am beside myself with worry.  I can't think straight. Am vomiting from  worry.  Have a headache that could split my head in two.  My biopsy results will be back on Thursday.  While I want the next 36 hrs to fly by I am also scared to death to answer that phone on Thursday. I keep playing the "I have bad news for you, Mrs. Brady" voice from the other end.  This just plain old sucks. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: What are chances of 2 false negative results from biopsies brady0819 Bless

Posts.Content: brady0819 wrote: I know I am being totally crazy, and you can all laugh and yell at me, but I value your support so much that I thought I'd ask for more of it right now. Back in Sept, I had initial mammo and ultrasound (age 37).  Radiologist found 1.6cm unpalpable lump in right breast. Birad4.  I did an ultrasound core needle biopsy and got benign results of normal breast tissue.  Just to make sure we hit the correct spot we followed up with a stereotactic biopsy, which also yielded normal breast tissue. I was scheduled for a 6 month follow up, which would have been mid-March.  However, this scare has been driving me crazy...constantly feeling for things that may or may not be there....wondering if these things are just fibrous tissue (as I have very fibrocystic breasts) or indeed lumps. I even went back to my surgeon about 3 weeks ago to have him check to see if he felt something on my right breast. He said "no" but did note that I have very dense breasts.  My 6 month follow up had now become an "almost 5 month follow-up" since I am so ready to get it over with and try to move on - one wasy or the other.  So, in 9 days I will have my follow up. I am scare to get less than good results. I am scared to hear the radiologist say, once again: step into my office...we are unsure...additional tests needed,etc. Am I being crazy. What are the odds that they made a mistake with both biopsies? Thank so much for your support. You women are a Godsend Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What are chances of 2 false negative results from biopsies brady0819 Bless

Posts.Content: brady0819 wrote: Just as I was getting calmer, I decided to pick up and fully read my mammo / us report. The findings read: solid mass in right breast for which tissue sampling is recommended, as malignancy is not excluded.  At the 2:00 position, there is a partially circumscribed solid mass which measures 1.6 x 1.1 x 1.0 cm.  There is posterior acoustic shadowing and some of the margins are macrolobulated and ill defined.  BIRADS category 4 (it does also refer to the fact that I have dense breasts) UGH!!! The radiologist said that the good things are that it is oval and "macro"lobulated.  The concerning part is the shadowing. Does this definitely points towards malignancies I had a core needle biopsy done on Tues.  Results read: "benign breast tissue"....nothing mentioned about fibrosis, etc. I am having a stereotactic biopsy done this Tuesday to ensure that the tissue from the mass was correctly excised. The surgeon doesn't seem to be too concerned and said we are jumping the gun in getting the lump totally removed through surgery. But - everything I have read says that 'posterior acoustic shadowing" related to malignancies. I am so damn confused. Yesterday and this morning I was feeling positive, now I am totally freaking out. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Freaking out again - finally read mammo / us report brady0819 flash

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 08:42PM brady0819 wrote: Thank you so much for providing me with so much support. The worst fear for me is the fear of the unknown.  I hate to wish my days away (especially with a 4 year old and 1 year old, in which each day they learn new and exciting things...totally amazing) but I have been wishing the past week away and am wishing the next week away until I can get more definitive results. This week began with an "unnecessary" mammo for my left breast and now I am faced with the possibility of breast cancer on my right breast.  It has been a roller coaster. I am grateful for how quick I have been able to get things accomplished, but after 5 days I am still faced with uncertainty.  My husband keeps reminding me that I should be happy that the core needle biopsy came back as "benign breast tissue" and not as a "malignancy".  Of course, I am.  But in the back of my head I still wonder what the hell this strange mass is on my right breast.  Normal breast tissue on a 1.6 cm dense mass seems far fetched. Have you ever heard of just simply "normal, benign breast tissue" coming back from a biopsy?  I can't believe that I am saying this, but - I am looking forward to my stereotactic biopsy on Tuesday...just to finally begin putting things in some sort of perspective and to move forward, whether it be good or bad. This just sucks.  Thank you, again, for your support and understanding.  You are all such a great group of women to lean on for me to cry, vent and express my frustrations.
Posts.Title: Freaking out again - finally read mammo / us report brady0819 flash

I know it is a long shot - but I am reaching for anything positive I can hold onto.  This waiting is killing me. I feel that it is consuming my every thought.  My husband I are going on vacation in 2 weeks (which we planned over 6 months ago).  How I would LOVE to go with a clear head.  If everything turns out benign I will have the biggest margarita known to man and celebrate.
Posts.Title: Freaking out again - finally read mammo / us report brady0819 flash

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2009 03:16PM brady0819 wrote: Thank you so much for helping me through this.  This is the most awful feeling in the world.  I feel like I can't even breathe anymore.  I am finding myself obsessed with searching for images like mine,  scenarios like mine,  etc.  I am at just such a low point.  I can't seem to shake this negative feeling. If you don't mind me asking:  what was your scenario?  Mammo?  Ultrasound?  What kind of biopsy?  I just keep thinking that in 3 days I will know if I do or don't have breast cancer and if my life is changed forever. Just to think - last month I was estatic about going on a this long-awaited vacation with my husband - my biggest worry was what kind of bathing suit should I buy.  Now I wonder - will this be a vacation of welcome relief of welcome dread.
Posts.Title: Freaking out again - finally read mammo / us report brady0819 flash

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2010 06:37PM brady0819 wrote: Hey Jude: Glad to hear that all is negative.  So happy for you.  About 1 year ago I had a baseline mammo and mammo and ultrasound found a 1.6cm lump on my right breast (at the time was UNpalpable, but I can now feel it). It was a BIRAD 4.  I had an ultrasound guided core needle biopsy.  Results came back as normal breast tissue.  My surgeon suggested a mammatome biopsy just to make sure he did indeed hit the correct spot.  Multiple samples were taken from both biopsies and even the mammatome results came back as normal fibroglandular breast tissue.  I had a 6 month mammo follow up and all came back BIRAD 1 - benign. So, it truly can be normal breast tissue. I worried myself sick wondering if there was anyway the surgeon missed the spot, but even my radiologist said that it is just indeed normal breast tissue.

Crazy, huh???? We get good results and still keep looking for more.  UGH!!!!! What a mind game! I guess he just wants to make certain that the correct area was tested (even though we got 3 good samples) so we will proceed with the stereotactic biopsy.  Have you ever hear of a pathology report simply stating "benign breast tissue"?  Am I just worrying myself sick (literally - as I keep vomiting thinking about this) - or should I just feel confident the next biopsy will also turn up benign results?  I hate this!!! I just want to be able to play with my darling daughters without the thought of breast cancer looming over my head.

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2010 02:07AM brady0819 wrote: I had my baseline mammo last September for a lump I felt on on my left breast.  That breast was okay but they saw a suspicous lump on my right breast (noone felt it - not me nor my obgyn).  I can't remember the exact verbage but it was :  "somewhat ill-defined", 3 cm with posterior acoustic shadowing".  Of course I began obsessed with researching these findings. Everything I saw that mentioned "posterior acoustic shadowing" suggested malignancy.  I had 2 biopsies. The first was ultrsound core needle.  Results: benign: normal breast tissue.  Beign unsatisified with these results we went forward with the mammatome biopsy.  Results : benign: normal breast tissue. I had a 6 month mammo follow up and got a Birad 1 score- everything benign. Please remember that over 80% of lumps are benign.  I worried myself sick over it. I know it is hard not to obsess over it (trust me - I still do...I am constantly poking and prodding at my breasts).  But, every case is different.  Don't go by exactly what you may read on the internet.  I wish I didn't.  I lost 8lbs in 10 days with worry and was a basketcase.  I wish I could have just remained positive. Praying that everything turns out okay.  I honestly think it will

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2010 03:10PM brady0819 wrote: Irr4993: Last Sept I went for my baseline mammo (37 yrs old) b/c I felt a lump in my left breast that hurt so bad, esp around my period.  Unexpectedly they found something unpalpable on my right breast  I had an immediate ultrasound. The radiologist took me into his office stating that he was unsure what it was and recommended a biopsy.  He said it was 50/50 in regards to cancer or not.  Not typical of a fibroadenoma but not totally leaning towards malignancy either.  I was so confused and shocked I got a copy of my report and it stated something in terms of :  somewhat ill defined, macrolobulated margins, posterior acoustic shadowing, 1.6 cm.  BiRad 4.  I freaked.  Everything I read pointed to cancer. The very next day I had an ultrasound guided core needle biopsy.  Results came back as normal breast tissue.  Just to make sure we hit the right spot, a breast surgeon did a mammatome biopsy.  Results again came back as normal breast tissue.    I know how hard the waiting is. I drove myself crazy. Didn't sleep.  Didn't eat.  Lost over 7 lbs in 10 days.  But please remember that the odds are on your side.  80% of findings are benign.
Posts.Title: experience with atypical firbrandenomas? lrr4993 lrr4993

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2010 08:58PM brady0819 wrote: Irr4993:  I am so sorry you are feeling this way, I truly am.  I can completely relate to what you are going through.  I wish I could say that the fear of BC  goes away, even after having a benign result, but for me, it hasn't.  After my scare last year the thought is always in the back of my mind.  I even find myself feeling my boobs excessively these days.  It sucks!!  But, like someone had told me - we have to live our lives, rather than being consumed with negative.  Please try to get some rest and do something that will take your mind off of the worry.  I began running during my scare as a way to avoid the "thinking".  I will be running my first half marathon next month.  It helps me to get all of the stresses out of my system. I am thinking about you and praying for benign results. I am confident that they will be. If you need to "chat" please don't hesitate to post or send me an email.  P.S. Sometimes a nice big glass of  wine helps, too.

This time it is due to a large lump on my right breast.  My OBG checked it out and said everything seemed normal and that it is just fibrocystic changes.  But, he was kind enough to submit an order for a diagnostic mammo and ultrasound to be performed for peace of mind.  I am getting them done tomorrow.  My period is due any day now so I think this is all due to hormones, but am still freaking out. I always have a painful lump that developes in my left breast when I ovulate, which is tender.  Now I have developed a painless lump on my right breast (upper area around 11 - 12:00).  I honestly cannot say if this is a normal occurrence in regards to my menstrual cycle. Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2010 12:39PM brady0819 wrote: Your situation sounds almost identical to mine. In Sept I went for a baseline mammo (age 37) because I felt a lump on my left breast (gets bigger after ovulation).  They did mammo and ultrasound and found nothing wrong with my left breast but found a 1.6cm solid mass on my right breast at the 2:00 position (which noone, including myself, obgyn and surgeon could feel) .  I was petrified.  Had an ultrasound core needle biopsy which came back as normal breast tissue. Just to be 100% sure they hit the correct spot I had a mammotome biopsy, which also yielded the exact same results...normal breast tissue.  Just had my follow up mammogram today (at 4.5 months since I was a basket case and couldn't wait another 1.5 months for the official "6 month follow up".   Everything is unchanged.  Spot is still there, but has not changed. I actually saw the 2 clips they placed on the biopsied area on mammogram today. The pathologist said nothing to worry about.  I meet with my breast surgeon on Thursday just to confirm that all is okay, but the radiologist today didn't even feel the need to do an ultrasound again. I will, however, be getting yearly mammograms...maybe even another in 6 months, which is fine by me.  This past scare has taught me to be very proactive and insist on tests, procedures and reassurance if I feel something is "just not right". Sounds like you in a similar situation.  Trust me - it took A LOT for me to relax about this. In fact, I didn't feel confident (even with 2 benign biopsies) until today.  In fact, I vomited twice this morning before my mammo.  But, just try to just think positive and be happy with your results.  I know - easier said than done.  Been there, done that.

Had 2 biopsies done in Sept (ultrasound core needle followed up by stereotactic mammotome biopsy) for an unpalpable mass found in right breast.  Both biopsies came back as just : normal benign breast tissue.  I have my 6 month follow up next week (which is actually 4.5 months, because I am so paranoid that I pushed it up 6 weeks).  Am so nervous. Just wondering if anyone else ever had findings come back as simply normal tissue Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone with biopsy results: normal breast tissue brady0819 Kam28

Posts.Content: brady0819 wrote: Hi Everyone: I am new to this board and am so thankful to have you all here.  I went in Monday for my 1st mammogram b/c of a lump I felt on my left breast.  After tons of scans and ultrasounds the radiologist informed me that he was concerned about something on my right breast.  He found a 1.6 cm solid mass, somewhat oval with smooth edges.  He could not rule out malignancy.  It was non palpable but seen on ultrasound. I met with the surgeon this morning and he also could not feel the mass but did see it on ultrasound measuring 1.6 cm.  He said it is at 2:00 and pretty superficial.  He said he is leaning towards "fibrocystic changes' but because of the shadowing underneath it, we biopsied it and sent it to pathology.  I am supposed to get the results Friday.  I am a nervous wreck. The nurse took me aside and said she thinks this is fine....and she normally does not say that unless she means it.  I am 37 with the 2 most beautiful daughters (4 and 1) and all I keep thinking about is not being here for them as they grow up.  The next 3 days are going to be brutal. I am trying to be strong but can't seem to hold it together Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just had biopsy done this morning - am PETRIFIED brady0819 brady0819

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2009 12:44AM brady0819 wrote: Okay- I am freaking out again. I should stop searching and searching the internet....but don't think I can til I get my biopsy results on Friday. Everything I read says that an irregularly shaped lump usually represents malignancy.  My lump was not round, but more oval with some irregularity to it (but with smooth edges).  Does this truly indicate a malignancy?  I am so darn scared.
Posts.Title: Just had biopsy done this morning - am PETRIFIED brady0819 brady0819

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2009 08:19PM brady0819 wrote: I was just thinking....again...I swear - my mind is on overdrive.  My period (and a bad one) started yesterday...the day after my mammo and the day of my biopsy.  We are all in agreement that I have fibrocystic breast changes going on.  Could this have  affected my mammo?  By affected I mean "could this thing they found on my right breast (hopefully some fibrocystic change) be a result of my period" and perhaps not have shown up if I didn't have my mammo on the day before my period came?  I have read that fibrocsytic breast disease is more evident with menstruation.  However, this mass on my right breast was unpalpable and only detected by mammo and ultrasound. What do you girls think?  Am I totally reaching here?
Posts.Title: Just had biopsy done this morning - am PETRIFIED brady0819 brady0819

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 01:50AM brady0819 wrote: In September of 2009 I had my first mammogram (at the age of 38) because of a lump on my left breast.  That turned out to be nothing, but the mammo and ultrasound found a lump on my right breast, that was unpalpable.  Talk about total shock.  Mine was also 1.2 cm and was "macro-obulated" and also had distinct posterior acoustic shadowing.  Needless to say I freaked out.  Everything I read pointed to BC.  I had an ultraound guided core biopsy, which came back as "normal breast tissue".  Just to make sure they got the right spot my surgeon did a mammotome biopsy.  Also came back as "normal breast tissue".  I had a 6 month follow up.  All normal.  Another 6 month follow up and all normal.  I am now due for my yearly mammogram.  It never gets easier. I am scared all of the time.  But, don't lose hope.  Your situation sounds extremely similar to mine. And I got all benign results.  Will be thinking of you.  We are all here for you.
Posts.Title: Help Please - hypoechoic with posterior acoustic enhancement partyofsix nlm

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2010 12:05PM brady0819 wrote: I am also worried, now. I am 38.  Had baseline mammo and ultrasound last Sept.  Had 2 biopsies on suspicous finding.  Both came back benign....normal breast tissue.  Follow up mammo 6 months later. Birad 1 - Benign. But, both mammos read heterogeneously dense breasts. Should I be worried?  I read somewhere that over 50% of pre-menoposaul women have dense breasts.
Posts.Title: Gentle Reminder about Dense Breasts Aug242007 Beanius

Posts.Content: brady0819 wrote: I had a core needle biopsy Tuesday.  The lump was not palpable (quite a shock to find it come up on mammogram and ultrasound).  Even the surgeon could not feel it.  The core needle biopsy wa ultrasound guided. My breast is now all bruised, although it does not hurt anymore.  But, now I can totally feel the lump.  Wondering if this is normal or could I just be feeling the bruising, etc.  This area where the incision was made is "extra lumpy".  Could this biopsy have aggravated whatever is there?  Is that normal? Driving myself crazy!!! Log in to post a reply
